intro: Monochaetum guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan monochaetum, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes the grass-like plants known as the "false grasses." The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
